alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 8:09AM CDT until July 28 at 4:28AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Dardenne Creek at St. Peters. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Dardenne Creek at St. Peters. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.5 feet, University of Missouri Agricultural Extension parking lot and greenhouse begins to flood near this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Dardenne Creek St. Peters 18.0 22.6 12.5 5.3 2.8 2.3 2.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
